qas.question: What Roman businesses were analogous to modern day pubs?
What similar establishments existed in the Anglo-Saxon world?
In what century did the tied house system develop?

context: The history of pubs can be traced back to Roman <a0_0>taverns<a0_0/>, through the Anglo-Saxon <a1_0>alehouse<a1_0/> to the development of the modern tied house system in the <a2_0>19th century<a2_0/>.
